intro: Malmeanthus subintegerrimus, commonly known as the roughleaf malmeanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Malmeanthus subintegerrimus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
